AirBnbModel package¶

Subpackages¶

  • AirBnbModel.source package
  • AirBnbModel.preprocess package
  • AirBnbModel.model package
  • AirBnbModel.utils package
  • AirBnbModel.tests package

Submodules¶

AirBnbModel.run module¶

Contains the main function of the package, which defines the execution of the package. main() has been decorated with ‘click’ so it can process command parameters.

AirBnbModel.run.main(task: str, mode: str)¶

Acts as a single entry point to all the functionallity of the package.

Parameters

  • task ({'source', 'preprocess', 'model'}) – the name of the task in the pipeline to be executed

  • mode ({'train_eval', 'predict'}) – the mode of execution of the task to be executed: ‘train_eval’ to train the different parameters of the model using training data; ‘predict’ to generate predictions using previously trained parameters.

Examples

Extract training data from source data stores and save it into a staging database:

>>> main('source', 'train_eval')

Read training data from a staging database and use it to extract preprocessing parameters and, after that, preprocess it:

>>> main('preprocess', 'train_eval')

Read preprocessed training data and use it to train a classification model:

>>> main('model', 'train_eval')

AirBnbModel.config module¶

Loads .yml configuration files located on ‘/configs’, and stores them into a Box object, so it can be latter imported and accessed programmatically on other scripts of the package.

For the training of the model, a dataset containing the information about users two different datasets have been provided:

  1. users.csv: Containing information about users registered in the platform (age, sex, language)

  2. sessions.csv: Containing information about actions taken in the website by the users on ‘users.csv’ (page view, checkout…)

  3. target.csv: The country destination of the first reservation made by the users on ‘users.csv’. 13 different outputs.

The objective of the model is to predict the country of destination of the first reservation, for a new user, given the information contained in *’users.csv’* and *’sessions.csv’*.
